instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message:
This board had some liquid damaged but not too bad and the LCD connector was butned on pins 3/4 I have removed the connector. I get a green light but it doesn't turn on. When the battery was plugged in the charger light would turn orange so the battery is being recognized

Here is a list of areas that had any liquid damage before I put flux and heated those components. I have not put it in the ultrasonic yet.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>
<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>
<CAPACITOR>C7012</CAPACITOR>
l6995 area
j5700 tpad connector
<CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> area of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>
pin 3 <CHIP>U5402</CHIP>
<CHIP>U7870</CHIP>
<RESISTOR>R5127</RESISTOR> area(<SIGNAL>SPI_ALT_MOSI</SIGNAL>)
<TRANSISTOR>Q9302</TRANSISTOR>
<TRANSISTOR>Q7330</TRANSISTOR>/35
<CHIP>U7840</CHIP>
<CAPACITOR>C7012</CAPACITOR>/13 were burned and replaced

I first replaced <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 & <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> and the pad on Pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> was gone and there was no continuity from Pin2 of <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> to Probe 556 so I ran a wire from <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> to Pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> & Probe 556.
That still didn't solve the issue so I replaced the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and still same issue.
Resistance Pins 17/18 - 2.9ohms Pins 27/28 - 20.8ohms

<CHIP>U7201</CHIP> had some liquid damage but no components look badly damaged. Here are some voltages of <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>
Pin 23(VIN) - 8.4v
Pin 22(VREG3) - 3.3v
Pin 29(VREG5) - 5.02v
Pin 12 - 0v
Pin 4 - 0v
Pin 21 - 3.51v
<RESISTOR>R7251</RESISTOR> has 0v on both sides.
<RESISTOR>R7813</RESISTOR> also 0v on both sides. (<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>)


I shorted the power pads next to the tpad connector and measured <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> going down to 0v and it still didn't turn on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message:
"Pin 12 - 0v
...
Pin 21 - 3.51v"
This not possible, unless you have corroded trace; or did wrong measurement...
Look at schematic, check <CHIP>U7840</CHIP> area. It should have same voltage at pins 2/3.

Also measure resistance to ground at L6995, in 200K scale.
You know, should be higher than 30K.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message:
I didn't push my probe all the way into the pin. Pin 12 is actually 3.43v. Pin 2 of <CHIP>U7840</CHIP> is 3.43v and Pin 3 is 3.51v

L6995 in 200k scale if I did correct shows around 66Kohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message:
Threw this in the ultrasonic and I shorted the power pads and the fan spun so it looks good. I will get some sleep, test everything together and update later today.

Update: Everything is working fine now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message:
I did an ASD OS test and it is telling me the Current(ID0R) DC IN sensor is reading below the low point.
I took an I/O Board+Cable from a 2011 MBA that passed the ID0R sensor test and I plugged it into this machine and that sensor still failed.

<RESISTOR>R5481</RESISTOR> and the surronding SMC area look spotless and the resistance measured fine. I believe it was measuring somewhere around 0.35v in voltage mode

In EFI version here is the hardware profile reading.

Low-Limit: 0.1A
High-Limit: 3.29A
Description: Current Sensor DCIN 0 Rail AMON
Reading 0.04A

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message:
I got a ID0R reading from a working 2011 MBA that passed the sensor test and this is what it showed on the hardware profile.
Low-Limit: 0.0A
High Limit: 3.5A
Reading: 0.000A

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message:
What has the IO board to do with this, please explain? 

This is of course an issue with the current sense circuits on the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message:
When I say DC-In I assumed that was the IO issue.
Pins 17/18 + 27/28 measure proper resistance. (2.9ohms & 20.7ohms)
I did do some repairs on Pins 17/18 as stated previously. I'm not sure if that is causing issues.

"(I replaced <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 & <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> and the pad on Pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> was gone and there was no continuity from Pin2 of <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> to Probe 556 so I ran a wire from <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> to Pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> & Probe 556)"

There is continuty all the way from pins 17/18 to the current sensing resistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message: Something is fucked in the current sense circuit. It is up to you what is wrong. Maybe wire is wrong or something.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message:
Okay I made a foolish mistake I was running the test without the charger plugged in. I plugged the charger in and did the test and it Passed this time.

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message: I ran the test again with the charger plugged in and it passed and the reading on ID0R was 2.1A. I removed the charger and did the test again and the reading showed 0.04A and failed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on (no s3 voltages)
threads.message: Yes, your current sensing circuit is not good.
